POWER CUTS AND HOW WE COULD FACE IT WITH EASE. We see the colossal waste allover. Be it public funds, power, energy, natural resources, you name it. Don’t we have educated people or think tanks in responsible positions of government Policy planning or is it that they do not care? The present power cuts forced on people are due to the lack of poor policy & planning at all levels. It is true that we have to depend on Hydro power. However had we been “Lean” in our operations we could have lesser power cuts or of lesser duration making it bearable to the general public not forgetting the waste of valuable time of the productive private sector, the life line or the national economy. Let’s discuss debate and observe following suggestions to overcome and face drought situations in the future with little discomforts. For this to be implemented a lot of co-ordination between a score of service providers are required and has to be exercised like a military drill to reap the benefits. This is how a layman would think. Why not the authorities? 1)Warn the general public in advance of impending power cuts 2-3 months in advance. 2)Impose the fuel adjustment charges in advance for the planned power cut period so that the consumer will be more alert to the high cost of energy bills and start using power sparingly. 3)One month before planned power cuts, authorities could disconnect power supply on areas where there is unwanted bright illumination. 4)Authorities can start disconnecting power supply to every 2 streets lights keeping one light on, or in essential areas it could be done alternatively. This has to commence one month before the planned power cuts. 5)It is very easy to switch on the street lights by 6.45 pm and switch off the lights by 5.00 am. 6)There are many by lanes or private roadways covering about 10 -15 houses provided with street lights at the cost of government. These lights should discontinued one – 2 months before impending power cuts and should be re connected when power generations is back to normalcy only. 7)Laws to prevent very large illumination boards displayed with high power intensity but limited to the bare minimum, applicable during power cut periods. 8)If all suggest could be implemented, saved energy would be quite sufficient to delay the power cuts by at least 30- 45 days. 26th March 2019.
